snippet: Over a dozen opposition radio stations broadcast into Syria, and some activists try to keep their signals, and themselves, alive by running operations from places like Turkey.
abstract: Istanbul Journal; dozens of opposition radio stations have sprung up outside of Syria in places like Istanbul since the start of the revolt against Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad; stations are the most recent arrivals on Syria's combative news media scene, and they seek to reach Syrians inside the country and believe FM the best way to do so.
lead_paragraph: Over a dozen opposition radio stations broadcast into Syria, and some activists try to keep their signals, and themselves, alive by running operations from places like Turkey.

headline.main: Pirate Radio Gives Voice to Syrian Opposition
headline.print_headline: Pirate Radio Gives Voice to Opposition Fighting Assad

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
